title.narrative: HESPI, Support to the Research Working Group on the Horn of Africa

description.narrative:
Detta är ett bidrag till forskningsgruppen för Afrikas Horn till stöd för aktiviteter vid Afrikanska Unionens genomförandepanel på hög nivå (AU-HIP) som förberedelse till konferenser om fred, säkerhet, stabilitet, samarbete och utveckling på Afrikas Horn och i Röda Havsområdet. Programmet består av policyrelaterad forskning och engagemang på tre områden där workshops kommer att genomföras och vars resultat slutligen presenteras i en rapport från AU-HIP till Afrikanska Unionens Freds- och Säkerhetsråd (AU-PSC).
HESPI kommer att ansvara för övergripande ledning, rapportering och organisera workshops. Arbetet inom de tre forskningsområdena kommer att ledas av HESPI, World Peace Foundation (WPF) respektive Goldsmiths, University of London.
Den totala budgeten för stödet är 14 641 200 SEK och kommer att täckas av fyra partnerländer, dvs. Danmark, Norge, Schweiz och Sverige. Sveriges bidrag kommer att vara totalt 3 500 000 SEK som utbetalas 2019 då andra partner kommer att göra utbetalningar senare. EU kommer också att bidra via Afrikanska Unionen (AU) till insatsen på särskilt definierade områden.

This is a support provided to the Research Working Group on Horn of Africa to support the activities of the African Union High Level Implementation Panel (AU-HIP), in preparation for the convening of the conferences on peace, security, stability, cooperation and development in the Horn of Africa and the Red Sea Arena. The programme consists of policy research and engagement in the three clustrs, leading to workshops and ultimatly to a report from the AU-HIP to the African Union Peace and Security Council (AU-PSC).
HESPI will be responsible for the overall management and reporting and organizing the workshops. There are three research clusters, each will be managed by the following: HESPI; World Peace Foundation (WPF); and Goldsmiths, University of London.
The total budget for the intervention is SEK 14 641 200 and will be covered by four partner countries including, Norway, Denmark, Switzerland and Sweden. Sweden's contribution will be a total of SEK 3 500 000 that will be disbursed in 2019 as other partners will make disbursements later. EU will also contribute through the African Union (AU) to the intervention in specificallly defined areas.

The intervention on, Research Working Group on Horn of Africa is to support the activities of the African Union High Level Implementation Panel (AU-HIP), in preparation for the convening of the conferences on peace, security, stability, cooperation and development in the Horn of Africa and the Red Sea Arena. The programme consists of policy research and engagement in the three clusters, leading to workshops and ultimately to a report from the AU-HIP to the African Union Peace and Security Council (AU-PSC). The support provided to the Research Working Group in Horn of Africa have the overall objectives to: • Support the African Union High-Level Implementation Panel (AUHIP) in conducting research on priority issues of high relevance to provide inputs into a final report to the AU Peace and Security Council and to convene the conference on peace, security, stability, cooperation and development on the Horn of Africa. • Deepen understandings of the dynamics of conflict and development, and organize research around three pillars i.e. (i) developing a security community in the Horn of Africa (HoA) and Red Sea arena; (ii) Regional integration and trade, infrastructure development, and addressing environmental and resource challenges; and (iii) democratization, diversity and state fragility, with a particular focus on gender and women’s activism. • Assist in the preparation of workshops, and provide final peer reviewed reports to assist in the preparatory work to convene the conference on peace, security, stability, cooperation and development in the Horn of Africa.

title.narrative: Grant Agreement between Sida and HESPI
Beslut Om Insats Forskningsgrupp för Afrikas Horn

description.narrative: The report for the first year of implementation is more focused in providing update on the progress achieved so far, not really diving into results. This was due to two reasons, one is the project itself is research focused and second, it is also the 1st year of implementation, creating difficulty to assess what was achieved by the project and analyse the changes made. The reporting is in line with the overall outline of the programme design and the outcome framework. In general, the project seems to have made good progress during the reporting period despite the COVID-19 context it was operating under. The deviation in this regard from the original plan has been justified in the report and different approaches and future plan of adjustment was also elaborated upon. HESPI was able to produce the expected outputs including, under pillar one, the preparation seven research reports and the reports were expected to be completed the second year of implementation. Under pillar two, the project has produced the first draft reports of the planned four studies. Under pillar three, five research reports were under preparation, the pillar's implementation is lagging behind, but a plan was developed to ensure drafts were ready by the end of July 2020. HESPI produced these outputs despite the delay in signing the grant agreement by some of the funding partners until October 2020. The financial report submitted is in line with the budget plan, with similar level of details. Sufficient explanation on some of the deviation from original plan was also provided.
